trivia_items.text: His codename is the German word for ebony, a type of black wood used in many musical instrument such as oboes, cellos, and the black keys used in keyboard instruments (i.e., pianos or harpsichords).

As the distant relative of the Witch King, Ebenholz is likely inspired by Western folklore of black goats being associated with evil and witchcraft, as in Akerbeltz in Basque legend or Baphomet in Gnosticism.

Two of the goat-headed figures in Ebenholz's E2 illustration resemble him and Kreide. They have a different eye colour (lavender) as opposed to the other figures (red), and are playing their respective instruments (flute and cello). The figures' horn shapes and clothing are also similar to Ebenholz and Kreide's.
As with Czerny, Ebenholz's English dialogues are spoken in German accent, but thicker than Czerny's. This is because his English voice actor, Atilla Akinci, was born in Germany.
sub_items: Notably, there are lines where he speaks or codeswitches in German, a trait not present in his Chinese, Korean or Japanese dialogues.
